isis.stitle: PRE-DELIVERY/QUALITY INSPECTION INSTRUCTION MANUAL FOR 3200, 3200 IM, HC, and LC MODELS - 3200, 3200 IM, HC, LC MODEL INSPECTION INSTRUCTIONS (REPORT S00022)

svcproc.title: 3200, 3200 IM, HC, LC MODEL INSPECTION INSTRUCTIONS (REPORT S00022)
svcproc.para: 1. Prepare vehicle for PDI inspection - see instruction manual

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, chock the wheels and turn the engine off.

item.para: PDI Inspection area should take place in a well-lit location with a level floor.
On air brake vehicles, release parking brake.
Indicate on Inspection Report the vehicle Model, Plant, PDI Facility, VIN, Service Invoice No., and Customer.

svcproc.para: 2. Check Build Sheet - correct configuration!

item.para: Verify presence of all appropriate features as specified on vehicle build sheet.

svcproc.para: 3. Routing and clipping under vehicle - secure, meets specifications

item.para: All cables, hoses, and wires should be:
5" from any heat source unless shielded
3" from any heat source if shielded
Clear from any rub or pinch point
Should NOT block access to any fluid fill point
Compressor discharge line should be free from any low points, or "traps"
There should be no audible air leaks.
If problems are found with routing and clipping or air leaks, correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 4. Center Bearing Alignment - square and tight

item.para: Verify that center bearing isolator is not out of carrier alignment.
Verify that center bearing assembly mounting bolts are tight.

svcproc.para: 5. Exhaust System - secure, tight, position, extends beyond body

item.para: Check that muffler / tailpipe hangers are tight.
Check that muffler / tailpipe clamps are tight.
Check that muffler / tailpipe assembly is positioned correctly.
Check that tailpipe extends beyond body.

svcproc.para: 6. Drive Axle Oil Level - full (ALL applicable drive axles)

item.para: Verify that drive axle oil level is filled level with fill port. Add fluid as needed.
Verify that rear axle drain plug is snug and leak-free.

svcproc.para: 7. Wheel Hub Gear Case Oil Level - all wheel hub gear cases (IM, LC Option Only)

item.para: Verify that oil level is filled level with fill port. Add fluid as needed.
Verify that drain plug is snug and leak-free.

svcproc.para: 8. Drop Box Oil Level - full (IM, LC Option Only)

item.para: Verify that oil level is filled level with fill port. Add fluid as needed.
Verify that drain plug is snug and leak-free.

svcproc.para: 9. Lubricate chassis - all grease zerks
10. Spring U-bolts - retorque

item.para: Refer to the Torque Chart for specifications.

svcproc.para: 11. Shock Absorbers / Bump Stops - securely installed

item.para: Verify that shock absorbers are securely installed.
Verify that bump stops are securely installed.

svcproc.para: 12. Slack adjusters - properly adjusted

item.para: Slack adjusters should be within the following adjustment ranges:
Standard stroke chambers are out of range at 2.0" total stroke.
Long stroke chambers are out of range at 2.5" total stroke.

svcproc.para: 13. Wheel Lug Nuts - retorque

item.para: Determine nut size, type, and torque specification.
Re-torque all wheel rim nuts following the proper tightening sequence.
Refer to the Wheels, Rims, and Tires section in GROUP 17 of the Master Service Manual for additional information.

svcproc.para: 14. Axle Flange Nuts - retorque

item.para: Make sure new gaskets have been installed on each axle removed by the transport carrier.
Tighten the nuts in a star pattern to the specified torque to ensure that axle flanges are properly seated. Refer to the Table below.

table.title: Axle Flange Nut and Bolt Torque Chart

svcproc.para: 15. Tires - proper inflation, valve stem caps are tight

item.para: Tire pressure should be checked with a pressure gauge.
Tires may come from the vendor inflated above the maximum pressure indicated on the sidewall.
If tires are inflated beyond the maximum pressure indicated on the sidewall, they should be left at that pressure.
Rear tires should be inflated to 90 +/- 5 psi, at minimum.
Front tires should be inflated to the maximum pressure indicated on the sidewall, at minimum.
Tire pressure should be equal for all tires on an axle.

svcproc.para: 16. Batteries/ Cables/ Cover - routing, tight, secure, greased, view eyes; Battery state of charge: 12.6 volts minimum

item.para: Battery cable end connections should be tight and secure.
Battery cable end connections should be protected by a dielectric grease.
Cables are not crimped or rubbing when box moves.
Batteries should be securely fastened in box.
Battery view eyes should not be obscured by cables or mounting hardware.

svcproc.para: 17. Tow hooks - secure

item.para: Tow hooks should be securely mounted to the frame.
If tow hooks are removable, frame mount must be securely mounted to frame.
If tow hooks are removable, tow hooks must be secure in their storage area.

svcproc.para: 18. External Paint, Trim, Chrome, Mirrors - condition

item.para: External painted surfaces should be free from runs, scratches, scuffs, dents, orange peel, bumps, holes, or other obvious defects.
Trim pieces should be securely affixed and aligned, and in good condition.
Chrome surfaces should be free from cracks, bubbles, scuffs, or other obvious defects.
Mirrors should be securely mounted and in good condition.

svcproc.para: 19. Storage Compartments - latches, hinges, lights, condition

item.para: Check function of all compartment lights

svcproc.para: 20. Windshield and glass - no damage

item.para: Windshield and other glass should be free from cracks, stars, chips, or other obvious defects.

svcproc.para: 21. Shore power / Block Heater connections - secure, function

item.para: Shore power connection should be mounted securely.
Shore power connection should function properly.
Block heater connection should be mounted securely.
Block heater connection should show continuity.

svcproc.para: 22. Hood Fit - secure, good alignment

item.para: Hood should be properly aligned with cab, lower fender extensions, and bumper.
Hood latches should be easily operated.

svcproc.para: 23. Fuel Tank - locking caps have keys

item.para: Fuel tank locking caps should have keys present with vehicle keys.

svcproc.para: 24. Mudflaps - secure, will not hit exhaust

item.para: Mudflaps should not hit exhaust tailpipe.

svcproc.para: 25. Turbo downpipe - tight and secure, no contact with other hardware

item.para: Verify turbo to downpipe connection is secure and well positioned.
Downpipe makes no contact with other vehicle hardware.

svcproc.para: 26. Air Filter Element - present, secure

item.para: Air filter element should be present.
Air filter should be securely installed.

svcproc.para: 27. Starter / Alternator / Ground Connections - tight, secure, greased

item.para: Inspect cable end tightness. Connections should be tight and coated with dielectric grease.
Cable ends make no contact with other vehicle hardware.

svcproc.para: 28. Engine compartment routing / clipping - secure, meets specifications

item.para: All cables, hoses, and wires should be:
5" from any heat source unless shielded.
3" from any heat source if shielded.
Clear from any rub or pinch point.
Should NOT block access to any fluid fill point.
Compressor discharge line should be free from any low points, or "traps".
There should be no audible air leaks.
If problems are found with routing and clipping or air leaks, correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 29. Engine compartment wire harness connections - fully latched / seated

item.para: Verify all wire harness electrical connections are securely latched.

svcproc.para: 30. Engine accessory drive belt(s) - properly installed

item.para: Drive belt should be properly aligned with pulleys.

svcproc.para: 31. Engine Oil Level - between ADD and FULL marks

item.para: Vehicle should be parked on a level surface.
Engine oil level should register between half-full and full on dipstick. Add proper oil as needed to correct fluid level.

svcproc.para: 32. Engine Coolant Level - above half full in range (or above lower view eye)

item.para: Coolant level should register between midpoint of MIN-MAX indicators and MAX indicator on transparent surge tank.

svcproc.para: 33. Engine Freeze Level - good to -40F / -40C
34. Hydraulic Brake Fluid Level - between ADD and FULL marks

item.para: Turn key ON if engine is not already running. Pump brake pedal quickly five times. Wait until pump motors stop running.
Hydraulic Brake fluid level should register between midpoint of MIN-MAX indicators and MAX indicator on transparent reservoir.
DO NOT OVERFILL. Reservoir can appear to be overfilled when key is in OFF position. Add appropriate fluid as needed to correct fluid level.

svcproc.para: 35. Automatic Transmission Fluid Level full/cooler hose connectors fully engaged

item.para: With vehicle running and in neutral or park position, check transmission fluid level. Fluid level should register between midpoint and Full mark in Cold range. Add appropriate fluid as needed to correct fluid level.

Verify that all (up to four) Snap-To-Connect (STC) fittings on each end of the two Transmission Oil Cooler hose sections are fully latched by grasping the tubing on each side of the connections and forcefully pushing the connectors together. Then pull forcefully on each side of the connection and attempt to pull the connectors apart to assure that the connection will not detach during use.

caution.para: Failure to fully latch the STC fittings can allow the fittings to come apart during use resulting in transmission failure due to oil loss.

svcproc.para: 36. Power Steering Fluid Level - between ADD and FULL marks

item.para: Power steering fluid level should register between half-full and full range. Add appropriate fluid as needed to correct fluid level.

svcproc.para: 37. Washer Fluid Level - between ADD and FULL marks

item.para: Washer fluid level should be half-full or higher. Add fluid as required.

svcproc.para: 38. Cotter keys / lock tabs present, properly spread - steering / brakes

item.para: Replace missing or damaged cotter keys or lock tabs.

svcproc.para: 39. Engine compartment hose clamps - tightness, position

item.para: Verify clamp orientation allows good access.

svcproc.para: 40. Steering Intermediate Shaft Pinch Bolts, Both Ends - torqued off

item.para: Pinch bolts should be twisted off at both ends of steering intermediate shaft.

svcproc.para: 41. OPEN ALL COOLANT VALVES BEFORE ROAD TEST

item.para: Open all coolant valves on vehicle prior to Road Test so that coolant circulates through all possible systems.

svcproc.para: 42. Interior panels, trim, molding, and floor coverings - neat, clean, secure..

item.para: Interior components should be neat and square.
Interior components should be well secured.

svcproc.para: 43. Windows - open and close properly.

item.para: Windows should open and close properly without binding, chattering, or excessive effort.

svcproc.para: 44. Auxiliary Heater - functions, secure (IM, HC, LC Option Only).

item.para: Auxiliary heater should be well secured.

svcproc.para: 45. Gauges and Dash Warning Lights - function properly.

item.para: With engine off and key in RUN position, warning lights will illuminate.
With engine off and key in RUN position, gauges will self test.

svcproc.para: 46. Neutral Safety Switch - starter activates in Neutral or Park position only

item.para: Select all gear ranges and turn key to START position. Starter MUST NOT ACTIVATE except in NEUTRAL or PARK position.

svcproc.para: 47. Lights - exterior, interior, and dome

item.para: Check interior lights, dome lights, and all exterior lights. Use of mirrors in inspection bay is recommended.

svcproc.para: 48. Doors - adjusted and work properly
49. Horn and Windshield Wiper / Washer - function and adjustment

item.para: Press center of steering wheel to operate electric horn.
Verify wipers work in all positions and do not contact each other or window frames.

svcproc.para: 50. Body Switches - function properly (IM, HC, LC Option Only)

item.para: Verify that all body switches operate accessories as labeled.

svcproc.para: 51. Passenger Area condition - restraints, seat, controls, windows (IM, HC, LC Option Only)

item.para: Verify proper installation, condition, and operation of Passenger's Area.

svcproc.para: 52. Driver's Area condition - restraints, seat, controls, windows, mirrors

item.para: Verify proper installation, condition, and operation of Driver's Area.

svcproc.para: 53. Clear inactive fault codes

item.para: Hook up Electronic Service Tool (EST). Clear inactive fault codes.

svcproc.para: 54. Gear Selector Function - each position selects correct gear

item.para: Gear selector should select correct gear in each gear selector position.

svcproc.para: 55. Park Brake Function - holds and rolls when it should

item.para: With Park Brake set and vehicle in drive gear, release service brake. Vehicle must not move. Park Brake indicator must be lit.
With Park Brake released, Park Brake light must not be visible.

svcproc.para: 56. Driver Controls - function properly

item.para: Check for proper function of systems:
Retarder (Do NOT engage retarder on slick road surfaces)

svcproc.para: 57. Gauges and Warning Lamps - function properly

item.para: Check for proper function of gauges:
Verify operation of all warning lamps
If any gauge goes to 6:00 position, data is out of range or not available.

svcproc.para: 58. Climate controls - function properly
59. Engine, Transmission, Brakes, Steering - performance

item.para: The following characteristics should be considered:
NVH (Noise, Vibration, and Harshness) - smooth and quiet, no shuddering, squeaking, buzzing, hissing, whining
Steering - Tight and straight, no pull or vibration
Water Temperature - 235 F max, engine hot
Volts - 12.5 - 15.5V with engine at idle and low electrical accessory load.
Each parameter should be within an acceptable range per vehicle type and class.
Road test course should be nominally 6 miles and should include reverse operation and full-lock turns in right and left directions. Road test should include road speed of 50 mph or higher.

svcproc.para: 60. Rear Air Suspension Dump - dumps, lifts (IM, LC Option Only)

item.para: Rear air suspension should dump, if so equipped, in 30 seconds or less.
Rear air suspension should lift, if so equipped, in 30 seconds or less.

svcproc.para: 61. Front Air Suspension Dump - dumps, lifts (IM, LC Option Only)

item.para: Front air suspension should dump, if so equipped, in 10 seconds or less.
Front air suspension should lift, if so equipped, in 10 seconds or less.

svcproc.para: 62. Steering Wheel Alignment - +/- 6 degrees

item.para: The steering wheel mounts to the steering column shaft by a 72 tooth spline. This spline mounting makes it impossible to perfectly align the steering wheel. Each spline represents 5 degrees. This means the steering wheel cannot be adjusted in less than 5 degree increments. If you have a 20 inch steering wheel, the 5 degrees represent 7/8 inch distance as measured at the outside edge of the wheel. If you have an 18 inch steering wheel, the 5 degrees represent 3/4 inch distance.

svcproc.para: 63. All Accessories as equipped - performance

item.para: Includes wheelchair lift (IM, LC option only).

svcproc.para: 64. Wind noise - no leaking body seals

item.para: Excessive wind noise indicates air intrusion into cab.

svcproc.para: 65. Fault Codes - check

item.para: Check for Hadley air system fault codes (IM, LC option only). Refer to Service Manual S10018.

svcproc.para: 66. Engine Coolant Level - between ADD and FULL marks

item.para: Coolant level should register between midpoint of MIN-MAX indicators and MAX indicator on transparent surge tank when engine is warm.

svcproc.para: 67. Fluid or Air Leaks - Cab/Engine Compartment/Chassis - none

item.para: There should be no visible fluid or audible air leaks.

svcproc.para: 68. Bottom Side Air/Fluid Leaks - none

item.para: Check gaskets, seals, hoses, connections, and low points on housings on components that contain fluids.
Verify manual operation of drain valves if equipped with air tank(s).

svcproc.para: 69. Air Tank Drain Valves - function properly

item.para: All air tank drain valves must function properly

svcproc.para: 70. PDI Location Code, Date - ADD to Vehicle Identification Label
71. Vehicle Certification Label - ADD - See NEW VEHICLE PROCESSING MANUAL
72. Operator's Manual is in vehicle
73. Pre-Delivery Service Identity Sticker (CTS-1122) - affix to windshield
74. COMMENTS - complete
75. Remove interior protective coverings, tags, tape
76. Wash Vehicle - look for interior leaks
